meanings.definition: A scene of uproar and disorder; a brawl or fight.
meanings.sent1: The donnybrook at the school playground was quickly broken up by the teachers.
meanings.sent2: The neighbors got into a loud donnybrook over the property line.
meanings.sent3: During the family reunion, Uncle Joe jokingly challenged Aunt Sally to a donnybrook over the last piece of pie.
meanings.sent4: The political debate turned into a donnybrook of conflicting ideas and raised voices.
meanings.sent5: The donnybrook between the rival soccer teams left the field in chaos.

meanings.sent1: The donnybrook between the siblings over who gets to choose the movie ended with tears.
meanings.sent2: The donnybrook at the town hall meeting was finally resolved through compromise.
meanings.sent3: The donnybrook between the friends about where to go for dinner was settled with a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The donnybrook between the politicians on live TV made for entertaining viewing.
meanings.sent5: The donnybrook between the two colleagues in the office was heard throughout the entire floor.
